title: Mahabharata | Part 33 | Game of Dice, the sequel | His Grace Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.key_quote: Mukam Karoti Vachalam Pankam Langa Yate Girim Yad Kripa Tamaham Vande Sri Gurum Deena Taranam
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras, offering obeisances to the spiritual master and Lord Krishna.

segments.key_quote: that old man has gone senile we had the pandavas and their kingdom in our grip and he left it off just like that
segments.summary: The speaker summarizes the previous episode and sets up the current one, focusing on the reactions of Duryodhana and his allies after Dhritarashtra reverses his decision and returns the Pandavas' possessions.

segments.key_quote: Somehow Hastinapura was not ours. We have got it in our hand. Now if we get into a battle with the Pandavas and lose Hastinapura also in our greed for Indraprastha, then we are left with, we are neither here nor there.
segments.summary: The speaker explains Duryodhana's fear of direct confrontation with the Pandavas and Shakuni's plan to manipulate them into another game of dice.

segments.key_quote: Sooner or later the Pandavas will gather some, on some pretext or the other, they will gather an army and attack us. We have to preempt this.
segments.summary: The speaker details Shakuni's plan for another game of dice and Duryodhana's efforts to convince Dhritarashtra, emphasizing the desire to preempt a potential war by sending the Pandavas into exile.

segments.key_quote: please hand over the kingdom to the Pandavas and banish Duryodhana from the family.
segments.summary: The speaker describes Gandhari's opposition to the game of dice and her advice to Dhritarashtra to favor the Pandavas, highlighting the conflict between righteousness and familial attachment.

segments.key_quote: It is the duty of a Kshatriya never to say no to a challenge.
segments.summary: The speaker explains Yudhishthira's acceptance of the invitation to another game of dice, emphasizing the Kshatriya's duty to uphold dharma and honor the commands of elders, even at personal cost.

segments.key_quote: If Duryodhana and I lose in this game of dice, then we all Kauravas will leave our kingdom. And we will live in the forest in exile for 12 years.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the conditions of the second game of dice, highlighting Shakuni's cunning in making the terms appear fair while ensuring the Pandavas' potential exile.

segments.key_quote: I am bound by the instructions of my elder, which is Dhritarashtra, and therefore I unwillingly am accepting these conditions. Let the dice roll.
segments.summary: The speaker narrates Yudhishthira's acceptance of the conditions and his subsequent loss, leading to the Pandavas' exile and fueling Bhima's anger and vows of revenge.

segments.key_quote: Vidura requested the Pandavas to entrust Kunti in his care and as long as the Pandavas would not return, Kunti could remain in his house.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the Pandavas' preparations for exile, including entrusting Kunti to Vidura's care and sending their sons to different locations for safety and education.

segments.key_quote: Thank you for joining us today. Hare Krishna!
segments.summary: The speaker concludes the episode and previews the upcoming events in the forest.
